alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Oldham; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 27 at 9:39PM CDT until May 28 at 3:07PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following areas, Deaf Smith, Oldham, Palo Duro Canyon, Potter and Randall. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - More heavy rain is expected across areas that have already received heavy rain during the past several days. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
